data: A lexical resource built upon WordNet, assigning sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to individual word senses (synsets).

Contains nearly 5,000 text snippets, collected from financial news and press releases of Finnish companies listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.
A dataset used for understanding sentiment in financial texts, combining artificial intelligence and semantic network techniques to better identify, interpret, and process opinions in this context.

Introduces entity-level sentiment annotation to address the challenge of titles containing multiple entities that may have conflicting sentiments. This manually annotated dataset contains over 10,700 news headlines, providing insights into specific entity sentiment changes in financial news.

A dataset of tokenized and annotated transcripts of Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) speeches, meeting minutes, and press conferences. This resource aims to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

A dataset of relations annotated in financial documents, containing approximately 29,000 instances and 22 relation types, covering eight entity pairs (e.g., Person-Title, Organization-Money), extracted from SEC 10-X report filings. Highly useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.
Compiled from various news sources and evaluated by human experts, allowing researchers to explore how news headlines affect price trends, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
A Named Entity Recognition (NER) dataset designed specifically for the financial domain, useful for identifying and classifying financial companies in text data.

Provides a multilingual financial Natural Language Processing (NLP) dataset containing real-world financial article headlines in 15 languages. High-level and low-level topics are annotated, useful for multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A dataset containing question-answer pairs for in-depth analysis of financial reports. Authored by financial experts, focusing on deep reasoning over financial data, providing training data to answer complex financial queries.
